reviewText: This is the third DVD of the series, and contains another four adventures of the five colorful friends known as the Backyardigans.Polka Palace Party introduces kids to four new genres of music.  The songs in the four adventures are themed to Polka, Irish folk music, Gilbert & Sullivan and Rockabilly.Unfortunately, the grouping in this DVD puts the two slower musical themes back to back, and between "High Tea" with its Irish theme and "The Heart of the Jungle" based on the music of Gilbert & Sullivan, my son lost interest and barely glanced at "Viking Voyage".Because of this, I am forced to watch Polka Palace Party repeatedly, as nobody wants to go any further.Not the best one to get for a first purchase, but still worth a look.Amanda Richards, February 5, 2006
summary: Not the best one to get for your first Backyardigan purchase

reviewText: This is just one of several Backyardigan videos we purchased.  I know some people break down which actor's voice was featured in which and talk about which style of music, but honestly with us it doesn't matter.  We're a family of music lovers and these are the BEST cartoons.  Pleasant, not at all annoying, (honestly the music is catchy, I wind up humming the songs all day) not the vulgar or innappropriate trash that passes for cartoons these days.  I have no problem with my kids watching these during any movie time they earn.

reviewText: this a great dvd...i even watch it!!!  my son especially loves the instruments featured, learning what a tuba is and what it sounds like, learning about teamwork and friendship.  also, the music is wonderful.
Title: N/A

reviewerName: Kelli of I'd So Rather Be Reading
reviewText: This Backyardigans DVD is one of my daughter's favorites.  The music is catchy (I often find myself humming along with the DVD), the colors are bright and engaging, and the story lines are easy to follow.  My little one has watched it so many times she knows almost all the words.The Backyardigans are more for entertainment than for learning (I consider Dora to provide some learning) but they are great and very engaging.  I don't mind watching them, unlike many other toddler TV shows (Calliou and Curious George, for example).

reviewText: Love the Backyardigans.  Such a fun program--the imagination of this group of friends is so vivid and I love the transformation from playing in the back yard to the fantasy world they are seeing and playing in.
